tools.name: get_logs
tools.description: Read recent application logs from the main container. Returns JSON-structured logs with support for filtering by level and timestamp. Handles multi-line stack traces.

level.description: Filter logs by level: debug, info, warn, error

lines.description: Number of recent log lines to return (default: 100, max: 10000)

since.description: Return only logs after this ISO 8601 timestamp

tools.name: check_health
tools.description: Query the main application's health endpoint to check its status. Returns HTTP status, response time, and parsed health information.

tools.name: get_config
tools.description: Read and display the application's configuration from YAML file. Automatically redacts sensitive values like passwords, tokens, secrets, and API keys. Supports reading entire config or specific keys using dot notation.

key.description: Optional: specific configuration key to retrieve using dot notation (e.g. database.host)

tools.name: list_endpoints
tools.description: List all available REST API endpoints with their HTTP methods, paths, and descriptions. Useful for discovering available operations and API surface area.

tools.name: search_logs
tools.description: Search application logs using regex patterns. Returns matching log lines with configurable context lines before and after each match. Supports time range filtering and full regex syntax for advanced pattern matching.

context_lines.description: Number of lines to show before and after each match (default: 2, max: 20)

max_results.description: Maximum number of matches to return (default: 50, max: 500)

pattern.description: Regex pattern to search for in log lines. Supports full regex syntax.

time_range.description: Filter logs to time range. Format: 1h, 24h, 7d, 30m

tools.name: get_metrics
tools.description: Retrieve current runtime metrics from the application's metrics endpoint. Returns metrics like request counts, response times, error rates, and resource utilization in a structured format.

tools.name: check_dependencies
tools.description: Check the status and availability of all external dependencies (databases, APIs, message queues, caches). Returns connection status, response time, and error details for each dependency.

tools.name: get_recent_errors
tools.description: Get recent error log entries from the application logs. Filters for ERROR level logs and returns them with timestamps and context. Useful for quick error diagnosis.

count.description: Number of recent errors to return (default: 20, max: 100)
